website_summaries.verdict: The Peel is an affordable iPhone/iPod universal remote that helps you filter your TV viewing options, but its current shortcomings--inability to bookmark future shows for recording and the dearth of a native iPad app--make the $99 hardware component tough to recommend.
pros: The Peel Universal Remote Control is an iOS remote app that interacts with an included Wi-Fi IR blaster
Part channel guide, part Tivo-esque personalized recommendations, and part remote, it's relatively easy to set up, and is multiroom capable
cons: The components--the Peel Cable and Peel Fruit--have to be placed within 25 feet of each other
Remote functionality doesn't measure up to that of the Harmony and other universal remotes
The user interface has some shortcomings, and it needs more DVR integration to be truly useful
There is currently no native iPad app, either

customer_reviews.title: 5 minutes of Remote bliss then it just stopped working
customer_reviews.text: The unit died almost immediately after setting it up. It worked for about 5 minutes and I really like the interface. I was able to setup the vizio tv, tivo, apple tv, and roku. After a few minutes of flipping channels and trying features it died. I did all the troubleshooting to no avail. Everything was hardwired and router was Apple TC so straight forward setup. I RMA the unit and may try again. Gadgets and technology are very frustrating after you have been using Apple and Linux for so many years which just work. It is worth trying as I may again.

customer_reviews.title: Not sure the purpose
customer_reviews.text: It's not clear to me who this product in intended for. It doesn't operate as a universal remote, lacking codes for many devices a Harmony would normally pick up. It also doesn't learn remotes nor help access other content on my DVR. It does do a good job of re-organizing live tv channels into a more interesting and informative manner, but overall this will not replace the need for other remotes in your household, and only serves as an interesting way to see whats on TV right now.

customer_reviews.title: not quite there
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a 75% there solution, my biggest issue is that it needs to be 15-20 feet from the Peel cable which is connected to your router... more than that ... does not work.... do not buy if your TV and router are not in the same room.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Watching TV just got simpler...A Great TV Guide + a whole lot more!!!
customer_reviews.text: I downloaded the Peel iPhone app yesterday at home. The App helped me discover a cool science channel show about the origins of the Universe. I didn't even know that I had a Science channel in my direct TV bundle. I use the App every time I watch TV now. It is so much easier to navigate than the menu cable and satellite providers force customers to use. It made me realize how frustrated I am by the 100 channels I don't watch or those that I don't get but am forced to scroll through when using a Cable remote. Peel seems so intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: StandByMe

customer_reviews.title: Not quite there
customer_reviews.text: This is a clever gadget with a lot of potential. Unfortunately it does not live up to the potential yet. The requirement that it be line-of-sight to the USB port is a deal-breaker for me; none of my TVs meet this criteria. Additionally, this unit is a bit tricky to set up, requiring downloading an app, etc. This latter issue is not a deal breaker. On the plus side the interface is nice and the hardware is good. A work in progress. RJB.
customer_reviews.author: Roger J. Buffington

customer_reviews.title: Only works on Apple products
customer_reviews.text: I didn't notice the Apple only when I ordered this, and I'm not an Apple guy, so I gave it to a friend who is, and he says it works great. Now his Iphone is also his remote. Cool, and I wish it worked with Android.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Nolan

customer_reviews.title: The New Way to Watch TV
customer_reviews.text: This device helps you browse TV programs by your preferred genres rather than by those random groups we call "channels." It's a novel way of thinking about how we select the best content to watch on television. The user interface is polished and intuitive, and it worked with my rather complex home theater system without any trouble at all.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: NOT a Universal Remote
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on a lark, it's going back to Best Buy. Is it really a Universal Remote if you can't control your XBox 360? The Harmony remotes are way ahead of this half baked attempt at a remote.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this about a month ago and it just does not work well as a remote. The social media aspect may be an interesting feature, but it needs to work as a remote control for me to use the device. It would not work with my Panasonic TV which was purchased at Costco. Nothing special about the TV, and I would think it should work with a name brand TV.

customer_reviews.title: A smart, simple universal remote
customer_reviews.text: Love the app! It cuts through all the junk on TV and only shows me things I'm interested in. The remote was simple and intuitive, unlike other universal remotes I've owned. Took 10 minutes to set up and operates my TV, DVD player, surround sound & Roku. I am going to buy another one for out entertainment system in the basement!

product_meta.title: Peel Universal Controller (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description: Peel is more than a remote - it's an entirely new TV experience. Peel combines a popular free app that lets you discover TV shows you'll love by learning ones you already like with seamless control of your whole entertainment system. Find your shows at your fingertips, watch with a single tap and control volume, channels, sources and more with simple gestures - all right from your iPhone or iPod touch.
